description: Dive into "Amsterdam's Hidden Beach Escapes" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Amsterdam's Hidden Beach Escapes

places.generalDescription: Het Twiske is a picturesque park located in the Amsterdam Area, offering a variety of activities for visitors. The park features scenic lakes, perfect for boating and swimming, as well as trails for walking and cycling. Families can enjoy picnics in designated areas while kids have fun at play areas. Nature enthusiasts will appreciate the wildlife viewing opportunities and the well-structured natural landscapes. Additionally, there are options for dining at quality restaurants within the park.

sources.snippet: Twiske Easy to reach by bike from Amsterdam Centrum, this 650-acre recreational area is located between Zaandam and Purmerend. There are 5 beaches, and plenty to do: swimming, diving, canoeing, fishing, sailing, and other water sports. There is also a water playground, a children‚Äôs farm, and picnic areas.
sources.shortName: Local Beach and Lake Destinations

places.name: Twiske

reviews.text: Het Twiske is a fantastic escape just outside Amsterdam! Perfect for walking, biking, and swimming, with scenic lakes and wooded paths. Dog-friendly too, with off-leash areas and a dog beach. There's also a marina, picnic spots, and a few cozy eateries, making it a great spot to unwind or spend an active day outdoors. The park is beautifully maintained and super accessible for a quick city escape Ôøº.

Great park, there are cows and nice walking paths. Far enough from Amsterdam to feel secluded and close enough to bike from the city center.

I came on a very windy day which made the biking much more difficult. I would avoid windy days.

Amazing place to visit with the family or your pet! They have many sticks for your dogs. There is plenty of parking spaces, many lakes, parks and different areas for walking & exploring. They have some picnic areas with sitting areas and trash cans. Very nice place to visit for the weekend!

places.generalDescription: Nestled along the picturesque banks of the River IJ in NDSM, Pllek is a vibrant waterfront restaurant that perfectly captures Amsterdam's laid-back spirit. This trendy spot, constructed from repurposed shipping containers, boasts an airy industrial-chic interior adorned with salvaged maritime decor. Step outside to discover a man-made beach complete with sun loungers and picnic tables, creating a delightful atmosphere reminiscent of coastal getaways.

sources.snippet: Look no further than this urban beach that has it all: Pllek‚Äôs a waterfront bar with pristine sandy spots to lay out your towel or lie back in a deck chair, and stunning skyline views of Amsterdam as you swim. Frequented by trendy Amsterdammers, this cultural hub that‚Äôs part of the NDSM Wharf, has been fashioned out of industrial shipping containers. Now, it‚Äôs a part-beach and part-live-music venue that serves all-day sustainable tapa-size dishes to share.
sources.shortName: The best Amsterdam beaches: 11 incredible summer spots to escape to

sources.snippet: Board the ferry across the IJ from Central Station and find a table on the urban beach of the industrial hotspot Pllek. Amsterdam natives travel from the center to Noord for this great beach, where you can bask in the sun while enjoying the beautiful view of the IJ. By loading the photos, you accept that Holland.com uses cookies to share data with third parties as described in our privacy statement (holland.com/privacy).
sources.shortName: City beaches in Amsterdam

sources.snippet: Just a short ferry hop over the IJ from Amsterdam Central station, this hip waterfront bar boasts its urban beach where locals and in-the-know visitors flock in summer months to enjoy great food, DJs and a vibrant atmosphere by day and night. Kick back on giant bean bags with a beer in hand and take in the views of Amsterdam across the water. Pllek | TT Neveritaweg 59, NDSM
sources.shortName: Urban beaches in Amsterdam

sources.snippet: It is located in NDSM, an industrial hotpots that is a home to art exhibitions, cultural happenings and PLLEK restaurants.People living nearby comes  here on the weekend to hangout at the small beachfront area and swim in the River. If you want to enjoy good music along with decent beer and burger then go ahead it‚Äôs a best beach in Amsterdam for this purpose.
sources.siteName: Explore the World with Adequate Travel - Your One-Stop Destination for Travel Planning-adequatetravel.com
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Amsterdam | Famous Beaches near Amsterdam, Netherlands

sources.snippet: Just a 20-minute ferry ride from Centraal Station, Pllek will give you the feeling of a beach holiday. The front of the restaurant opens to a beautiful view of the IJ, with picnic tables and the beach. The space also hosts music, parties, films and a variety of cultural activities like outdoor films, art exhibits, kids programs, morning yoga and Tai Chi.
sources.shortName: Beaches nearby Amsterdam | City Hotel Rembrandt Square Amsterdam

sources.snippet: Pllek is an urban beach located in Amsterdam North, on the NDSM wharf. It has a sand beach where you can chill out after your visit to the Amsterdam Street museum and there is a restaurant at the beach. The view over the IJ canal is breathtaking and the spot is sunny all day long when the weather is good.
sources.shortName: BEST BEACHES AMSTERDAM -

sources.snippet: An urban beach with a twist, Pllek effortlessly fuses the serene ambiance of a waterfront with the energetic buzz of a cultural center. Set within the NDSM Wharf, Pllek‚Äôs creative use of industrial shipping containers crafts a unique beachside environment.
sources.shortName: ·êÖ 11 BEST Beaches In Amsterdam For a Perfect Trip in 2024

sources.snippet: Pllek This riverfront location, at NDSM in Noord, is an up-and-coming hangout with fabulous street art, galleries and cafes. It is also home to the popular monthly IjHallen giant flea market. An easy, free 20 min ferry ride from Centraal.
sources.shortName: Local Beach and Lake Destinations

sources.snippet: This beach is accessible via ferry across the IJ River from Amsterdam Central Station. From here you will arrive in the Noord industrial hotspot that is home to cultural happenings, art exhibitions, and Pllek!
sources.shortName: Best Amsterdam Beaches: Recommended by a Local

sources.snippet: Pllek is the place to be for people in search of beachy vibes. Here they love animals, green and live music. Chill out in the sun with a plant-based or biological snack and a craft beer.
sources.shortName: The Best City Beaches in Amsterdam

sources.snippet: It doesn‚Äôt really matter what kind of weather it is, Pllek is always filled with people. During the weekends you can enjoy live music andDJ‚Äôs. Most of the menu is organic and local.
sources.shortName: 12X CITY BEACHES IN AND NEAR AMSTERDAM
10 Best Beaches in Amsterdam For a Sun-Kissed Getaway in 2024!

places.name: Pllek

reviews.text: I went there for a coffee, but ended up discovering it's also a great spot for a beer. The menu has good vegetarian and vegan options, and my order was amazing. The service was great and the place is beautiful, with both indoor and outdoor seating. The view outside is incredible, perfect for enjoying a late afternoon. Highly recommend!

I enjoyed the beautiful summer view and the pleasant breeze. However, the samosa didn't quite meet my expectations, possibly because I'm used to Indian samosas. Despite this, the atmosphere was great and enjoyable, with an amazing view.
Superb spot! Great location with cool vibes. Perfect for sundowners. Book if you want a table but there's also plenty of outside seating which is first come first served.

places.generalDescription: Hip, all-pink hangout with a ball pit & umbrellas serving lite American eats, wine & cocktails.

sources.snippet: Now, this is a guilty pleasure of mine - it‚Äôs an Instagrammable hangout right in the neighbourhood of Amsterdam Noord. Beyond chic, everything is decked out in Barbie pink from the cocktail bar that serves up fun drinks in disco balls, to the pink sand where you can chill under the parasol. It‚Äôs an oasis for those who like live DJs dance parties and tropical vibes.
sources.shortName: The best Amsterdam beaches: 11 incredible summer spots to escape to

places.name: Pink Beach by WONDR

reviews.text: This place has a magical atmosphere! Even my not so impressed boyfriend had a lot of fun here and the cocktails were absolutely delicious! You should definitely check this place out. the staff is extremely friendly and just get good vibes! Also; thank you very much for taking pictures of us!
Incredible staff and very good drinks for a decent price!!!! Alejandro made sure me and my friend had the best time here!

It's a very cute place to take some photos, have a drink and just relax for a bit. It looks really similar to a pink beach that I went to in Ibiza even the music was similar, so it bought back great memories. ü©∑ The staff was very attentive & kind but not too pushy - thank you for that. I had the flamingo cocktail which was a bit light but I thought it was delicious. I would highly recommend and coming back here next week for some cute photos!!

places.generalDescription: Gaasperplas is a serene and picturesque nature reserve located to the southeast of Amsterdam. It offers a tranquil escape with its blue-green waters, narrow white paths, and quiet corners adorned with wooden benches. The area is perfect for family gatherings, featuring spaces for BBQs and activities suitable for all ages. Gaasperplas also boasts a dog park with a small beach where you can find adorable paw impressions in the sand.

sources.snippet: Gaasperplas This beach in the south-east is equipped with toilets and showers, and has apparatus in the water for the children to play on.map
sources.shortName: Local Beach and Lake Destinations

places.name: Gaasperplas

reviews.text: Nice for a walk or to chill. Strangely barbecue not allowed but if its less than 4 people, you wont be bothered by regular patrolling.
Love this place, have had a lot of Family  BBQ's here. Nice park for a all ages. Must see place. This have had some changes over the year, yet it is the same.

Gaasperplas is a blue-green bubble of tranquillity with water as the central element. During the walk, the city feels far away but it isn't. Narrow white paths attract you with quiet corners and wooden benches. Beautiful nature to admire.

places.generalDescription: Sloterplas Beach, located just outside the city, offers a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of urban life. While it may not be a cultural hotspot, it provides a serene lake experience perfect for swimming. However, visitors should be aware that there are no lifeguards on duty. In the late summer months, blue algae can be present in the water, though efforts to improve water quality are underway with mussel farms being installed for filtration.

sources.snippet: One of the largest beaches on the Amsterdam, there is a clean white sand and water is accessible for swimming and trees are also available for shade.Though it‚Äôs a bit outside of the city but it is quite one calmer. It is not a ethnic or local hotpots, but it does offer a nice and quiet experience.There are some playgrounds, places to eat and drink and wading pools
sources.siteName: Explore the World with Adequate Travel - Your One-Stop Destination for Travel Planning-adequatetravel.com
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Amsterdam | Famous Beaches near Amsterdam, Netherlands

sources.snippet: Tucked away just past the neighbourhood of Amsterdam West, is Sloterplas Beach. A favourite amongst families, there‚Äôs table tennis, volleyball fields, and food trucks parked around during the summer. If you go for a swim in the lake, just watch out for the steep drop-off into the water though you‚Äôll see the buoy designating which area is open for swimming.
sources.shortName: The best Amsterdam beaches: 11 incredible summer spots to escape to

sources.snippet: This swimming lake in Amsterdam Nieuw-West is among the neighbourhood's best summer hotspots. The family-friendly urban beach boasts picnic tables, a wide-open space and a nifty beach shop where you can rent beach chairs, volleyball gear, mobile showers and other handy equipment. Sloterplas Beach | President Allendelaan 1, Nieuw West
sources.shortName: Urban beaches in Amsterdam

sources.snippet: This swimming beach in  West is under development and has been transformed into a lovely urban beach. There are plenty of things to do: volleyball, sports and games programs... You can enjoy great food and drinks and sometimes there are shows and festivals.
sources.shortName: City beaches in Amsterdam

sources.snippet: Sloterplas Beach is a bit outside of the city, but therefore also one of the more calmer city beaches. It is not a cultural or local hotspot, but it does offer a nice and quiet lake experience.
sources.shortName: The Best City Beaches in Amsterdam

sources.snippet: But don‚Äôt worry, there is a ton of room on the golden sand for everyone to lay out without being crammed together. This beach is so popular because it has something for everyone.
sources.shortName: Best Amsterdam Beaches: Recommended by a Local

places.name: Sloterplas Beach

reviews.text: Great for swimming however no lifeguards a child drowned this year due to overcrowding and no supervision on the beach ....late summers every year there is blue algae in the water but they have installed mussel farms to filtrate the water but it will take a long time before a summer goes by without blue algae ....this city beach can become very crowded in the summer so if you want to be in the sand arrive early ...and the council needs to put lifeguards on duty if it is a BEACH ...however parents should also watch there kids

Great to go in a sunny day. They have a little beach by the side of the lake. A small section but you can swim if the water is not too cold. Had an awesome picnic with my friends. We painted, read and write while Sofy slept and it was just the perfect way to the sun tell us goodbye.
A quiet small beach perfect to watch the sunrise and sunset. Worth a visit if you are in that side of town.

places.generalDescription: Sloterplas is an artificial lake in Amsterdam, surrounded by tree-shaded trails and featuring a beach with designated safe swimming areas. It was originally a natural lake called Slootemeer before being reclaimed using windmills in 1644. The area became solid ground for three centuries before turning back into a lake due to construction needs. Located in the Nieuw West neighborhood, it's easily accessible by public transport.

sources.snippet: What is it: In the leafy Nieuw-West neighbourhood, Sloterplas lake offers crystal-clear water that‚Äôs always refreshingly cool. There are also a sailing school and water sports centre where you can hire equipment and sign up for lessons.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Beaches in Amsterdam Right Now

sources.snippet: Sloterplas, one of Amsterdam‚Äôs most expansive beaches, features pristine sandy shores, designated safe swimming areas, sun lounger rentals, and ample shaded spots. But would you believe that this great beach is located in the Leafy Nieuw West Neighbourhood?
sources.shortName: ·êÖ 11 BEST Beaches In Amsterdam For a Perfect Trip in 2024

sources.snippet: The lake was excavated into a recreational lake from the lower-lying part of the Sloterdijkermeerpolder in 1935. The Sloterpakbad was opened on the northwest side of the lake. The Sloterplas is used for sailing, canoeing, fishing, and diving.
sources.shortName: BEST BEACHES AMSTERDAM -

sources.snippet: Loop trail around the Sloterplas, the popular natural and recreational lake of Amsterdam. Slotermeer was dug out into a recreational lake in the late 1940s. Originally this area was a polder.
sources.shortName: Best beach trails in Amsterdam
10 Best Beaches in Amsterdam For a Sun-Kissed Getaway in 2024!
Local Beach and Lake Destinations

places.name: Sloterplas

reviews.text: After somehow biking out here from central Amsterdam and enjoying the wonderful tranquility, we barely were able to make it back - legs were hurting. But while we were there, it was a total departure from the hustle, bustle, no-space giving throngs of tourists in Central Amsterdam. Quite beautiful, tranquil, and free from tourists, except us!

Huge artificial lake where you can swim, surrounded by green areas. There's a sand beach where you can play volleyball and there are also tables for picnic! Wonderful place for a ride or a walk with sunset views.

If travelling from the city centre you'd have to walk through many residential estates and it is easy to get lost. Once inside the park is peaceful however it's easiest just to go to Vondelpark or artis if in the city

sources.snippet: We owe the existence of Gaasperpark to the expansion of the Bijlmermeer. This recreational and nature reserve, which was created by sand extraction for the construction of the flats, covers around 166 hectares, meaning there is always a good spot where you can plop down with your beach towel and soak up some of those elusive rays. Plus with designated spots for barbecuing and water sports, there's plenty to do to keep everyone fed and entertained.
sources.shortName: Urban beaches in Amsterdam

reviews.text: Holy sunny Sunday afternoon in this park was pure bliss

Gaasperplas is a beautiful lake located in the southeast of Amsterdam, and it's definitely worth a visit if you're looking for a relaxing day outdoors.

The lake is surrounded by a large park and greenery including a beach and camping spot on the southeast side (With baths and bathrooms and grills). Making it a great spot for a picnic or a leisurely walk.
You can also rent/take a boat or go fishing on the lake.

One thing to note is that the water quality of the lake can sometimes be an issue, so it's important to check the current status before planning a swim. Additionally, during busy periods the lake can become quite crowded, which can detract from the peaceful ambiance.

Overall, Gaasperplas is a great spot to unwind and enjoy the natural beauty of Amsterdam.
Very nice place for walking, dog walking or just rest.

places.generalDescription: Located south of the city center, Strandzuid is a trendy inland beach complex surrounding a lake. It features a stylish restaurant, a large beer deck with activities like ping pong, and a sandy party beach with ample sunbathing spots connected by boardwalks. The menu offers diverse options including fish, meat, and vegetarian dishes prepared on a traditional charcoal grill for that summertime flavor boost.

sources.snippet: Kick back on a day bed sipping ros√©, then head to the beer terrace as the sun sets to sample local brews and play ping-pong with your crew.
sources.shortName: 9 Best Beaches in Amsterdam Right Now

sources.snippet: Strand Zuid in Amsterdam is located between the Amsterdam RAI exhibition center and the Beatrixpark (Europaplein 22), and boasts over 2000 m2 (over 6,600 square feet) of man-made beach property. Strand Zuid has the image of being a more luxury beach, and in the summer, the upper class of Amsterdam love to come here to lounge, sip cocktails, and see and be seen. But don‚Äôt let this trendy image of Strand Zuid scare you off.
sources.shortName: City beaches in Amsterdam

sources.snippet: South of the city centre, StrandZuid is a chic inland beach complex surrounding a lake. It has a stylish restaurant, a large beer deck with a ping-pong table, and a sandy party beach with plenty of sunbathing spots connected by a series of boardwalks. The restaurant menu offers plenty of fish, meat, and vegetarian options, and for a summertime flavour boost, many dishes are prepared on the traditional charcoal grill.
sources.shortName: Urban beaches in Amsterdam

sources.snippet: Just behind the RAI Convention Centre, Strandzuid is among the best beaches in Amsterdam. It is an ideal spot for beach breaks and you can also enjoy the game of  volleyball while your on the beach. It is a perfect place for lunch,dinner or if you want a drink to start a sunny day in the city.Take a seat on sunny terrace or sit back and relax and enjoy the beach viber over here.
sources.siteName: Explore the World with Adequate Travel - Your One-Stop Destination for Travel Planning-adequatetravel.com
sources.shortName: Best Beaches in Amsterdam | Famous Beaches near Amsterdam, Netherlands

sources.snippet: Strandzuid in Amsterdam is located between the Amsterdam RAI exhibition center and the Beatrixpark and boasts over 2000 m2 property. Strandzuid is famous for drinks, weddings, meetings, company parties and group dinners and falls under the top beaches of Amsterdam, even during winter!. The beach offers countless hammocks and lounge chairs as well as a volleyball court.
sources.shortName: Beaches nearby Amsterdam | City Hotel Rembrandt Square Amsterdam

sources.snippet: Hidden behind the modern RAI Convention Center, you will find Strandzuid. This city beach will open May 1 st and is the hotspot of the city. With beautiful sunbeds, volleyball tournaments and a classy food & drinks menu, this venue takes you right to a hip lounge bar on Bali or Ibiza.
sources.shortName: The Best City Beaches in Amsterdam

sources.snippet: Strandzuid is also a popular place for after work drinks with colleagues, and on Fridays it‚Äôs full house around the beach bar. You‚Äôll almost forget that you are in the middle of Amsterdam when you chill on the beach chairs. Strandzuid opens daily for lunch, brunch and dinner.
sources.shortName: 12X CITY BEACHES IN AND NEAR AMSTERDAM

sources.snippet: While many top beaches lean into Amsterdam‚Äôs coastal vibes, StrandZuid offers something a bit different. Tucked away in the picturesque Beatrix Park in South Amsterdam, this city beach gives you that genuine beach vacation feel right in the midst of the city centre.
sources.shortName: ·êÖ 11 BEST Beaches In Amsterdam For a Perfect Trip in 2024

sources.snippet: Strand Zuid is regarded as one of the more luxurious beaches in Amsterdam that attracts a more affluent crowd. Despite its high-class image, Amsterdam locals of all classes flock here to kick back on a day bed, drink cold cocktails, and enjoy the nearby water.
sources.shortName: Best Amsterdam Beaches: Recommended by a Local
10 Best Beaches in Amsterdam For a Sun-Kissed Getaway in 2024!

places.name: Strandzuid

reviews.text:
Food was fine, nothing wow on the main dishes.

I did a reservation and when my friends arrived the staff didn't know about my reservation (when I arrived the girl at the entrance immediately took us to our table) - besides that on a sunny day the place is amazing!

It's located in a lovely park.

Was here on probably the hottest day on record in Amsterdam (1st July 2025), for an after party. Great venue, good atmosphere, just too hot to really enjoy it. Would still recommend though! If you're reading this, management team... Maybe get some recyclable paper fans or something? ‚ò∫Ô∏è

A very nice hidden gem in the middle of the city. Such a nice place to visit and spend afternoons on sunny days here next to water. Their nachos, vegan burgers and bitterbalen are tasty. Only things is; it may be tricky to access because there is no big signs or something pointing to where the entrance is.

places.generalDescription: De Hoge Dijk is a sprawling park located in Amsterdam-Zuidoost, offering a range of activities for visitors. The primary feature of the park is its golf complex, which includes three courses with 27 holes. Golf enthusiasts will find themselves in their element here, with varying levels of difficulty across the courses. Additionally, the eastern section of De Hoge Dijk boasts a large lake with a beach area, providing an opportunity for swimming and relaxation.

sources.shortName: Local Beach and Lake Destinations

places.name: De Hoge Dijk

reviews.text: ‚ÄúHonestly, visiting this golf center was one of the best experiences I've ever had. The facility offers professional training and a warm, welcoming atmosphere. I was particularly impressed by the hospitality of Mr. Mark at the reception and Coach fltichard from South Africa. I highly recommend visiting this place, especially to enjoy dessert and tea at sunset. I truly appreciate their effort in making golf accessible to all tourists and visitors.‚Äù

Good course, fun time there. It's neat and pretty easy for most players. Not too much danger for higher handicap players which is quite enjoyable.
The only thing was that we were not told that the greens were aerated, which was a bit of shame. They really rolled badly, on top of being already a bit damaged. Had we know, we would have probably played somewhere else.

Apart from that, everything was good and the people were lovely.
I put 4 stars for the green conditions, but note that this is very positive and does not mean that it is not a good course.

Thanks for the time!

Great course, welcomed warmly by the lady at the check in point

The fairways were exceptional and some of the greens need to be worked. Overall a great experience. Don't play on windy days though ü§£ü§£ü§£. It was crazy out there yesterday.

The drinks after and the snacks were awesome. The bartender was awesome as well. Looked after us well.

I'd be honest at points it felt like was playing the PGA tour. Great layout. Will definitely be back. Thank you
